channel.title: Joe Buhlig
channel.description: leverage the digital and welcome real life

item.title: 51: Great at Work by Morten Hansen
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: There is a myth in the workplace that says we need to work longer hours to achieve more and do so with higher quality. But this is purely a myth and there’s a lot of science to prove it.
item.content:encoded: There is a myth in the workplace that says we need to work longer hours to achieve more and do so with higher quality. But this is purely a myth and there’s a lot of science to prove it.

item.title: 50: 2018 Bookworm Draft
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: If you listen to Bookworm as a way to filter your book list, then this episode will blow your mind. Joe and Mike pick their top ten books draft-style. They’re not necessarily Bookworm books either. Also included: a special surprise.
item.content:encoded: If you listen to Bookworm as a way to filter your book list, then this episode will blow your mind. Joe and Mike pick their top ten books draft-style. They’re not necessarily Bookworm books either. Also included: a special surprise.

item.title: 49: Peak by Anders Ericsson
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: What does it take to become the best? And what do the world’s greatest do that puts them at the top? And how does that translate into our day to day lives?
item.content:encoded: What does it take to become the best? And what do the world’s greatest do that puts them at the top? And how does that translate into our day to day lives?

item.title: 48: How to Win Friends and Influence People by Dale Carnegie
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: It’s time for another classic that both Mike and Joe are a bit embarrassed they haven’t read previously. And it turns out to be a book where the title doesn’t do it justice.
item.content:encoded: It’s time for another classic that both Mike and Joe are a bit embarrassed they haven’t read previously. And it turns out to be a book where the title doesn’t do it justice.

item.title: 47: The Three Big Questions for a Frantic Family by Patrick Lencioni
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Should you think about your family in the same way you think about an organization? And what are the ramifications of the answer to that question?
item.content:encoded: Should you think about your family in the same way you think about an organization? And what are the ramifications of the answer to that question?

item.title: 46: Busy by Tony Crabbe
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Don’t have time to read books? Then listen to this! Joe and Mike jump into the topic of a busy culture and what we can do about it.
item.content:encoded: Don’t have time to read books? Then listen to this! Joe and Mike jump into the topic of a busy culture and what we can do about it.

item.title: 45: What’s Best Next by Matt Perman
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: What does the Bible say about productivity? And how does this book compare to other productivity books?
item.content:encoded: What does the Bible say about productivity? And how does this book compare to other productivity books?

item.title: 44: Man’s Search for Meaning by Victor Frankl
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Knowing your purpose and finding meaning in life can save your life. This episode covers the challenging topic of World War II and escaping concentration camps alive.
item.content:encoded: Knowing your purpose and finding meaning in life can save your life. This episode covers the challenging topic of World War II and escaping concentration camps alive.

item.title: 43: Flow by Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Mike and Joe have mentioned Mihaly way too often. So it’s about time they covered his book and discussed it directly.
item.content:encoded: Mike and Joe have mentioned Mihaly way too often. So it’s about time they covered his book and discussed it directly.

item.title: 42: How to Read a Book by Mortimer Adler
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: It’s finally here. An episode about how to read a book. And what better way to cover the topic than to read a book about it.
item.content:encoded: It’s finally here. An episode about how to read a book. And what better way to cover the topic than to read a book about it.

item.title: 41: 168 Hours by Laura Vanderkam
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Where does your time go? And do you actually spend it where you think you do? These are tough questions when you dive into it, which is exactly what Mike and Joe do.
item.content:encoded: Where does your time go? And do you actually spend it where you think you do? These are tough questions when you dive into it, which is exactly what Mike and Joe do.

item.title: 17: I Don’t Think Anyone Likes Homework
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: It’s 2018! How are Joe and Drew spending their mornings? Drew shares about a new upgrade to his analogue game, and Joe asks an interesting question: If you’re a book person, how does it feel to want to share that information with others?
item.content:encoded: It’s 2018! How are Joe and Drew spending their mornings? Drew shares about a new upgrade to his analogue game, and Joe asks an interesting question: If you’re a book person, how does it feel to want to share that information with others?

item.title: 33: IPhone X is Small
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Josh thinks the iPhone X is too small and doesn’t like it. Joe thinks he’s being ridiculous. And Josh has a pseudo-conspiracy theory.
item.content:encoded: Josh thinks the iPhone X is too small and doesn’t like it. Joe thinks he’s being ridiculous. And Josh has a pseudo-conspiracy theory.

item.title: 40: The Artist’s Way by Julia Cameron
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Morning Pages has been an intriguing concept to both Mike and Joe. So they finally jump into the source of the practice. There’s a time commitment involved but they both seem okay with that.
item.content:encoded: Morning Pages has been an intriguing concept to both Mike and Joe. So they finally jump into the source of the practice. There’s a time commitment involved but they both seem okay with that.

item.title: 16: Multiple Fountain Pens, My God
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Drew needs Joe’s help. It’s about pens.
item.content:encoded: Drew needs Joe’s help. It’s about pens.
